ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: It interactively or programmatically label points within custom gates on two dimensions <https://github.com/stemangiola/tidygate>. The information is added to your tibble. It is based on the package 'gatepoints' from Wajid Jawaid (who is also author of this package). The code of 'gatepoints' was nto integrated in 'tidygate'. The benefits are (i) in interactive mode you can draw your gates on extensive 'ggplot'-like scatter plots; (ii) you can draw multiple gates; and (iii) you can save your gates and apply the programmatically.

It interactively or programmatically label points within custom gates on two dimensions <https://github.com/stemangiola/tidygate>. The information is added to your tibble. It is based on the package 'gatepoints' from Wajid Jawaid (who is also author of this package). The code of 'gatepoints' was nto integrated in 'tidygate'. The benefits are (i) in interactive mode you can draw your gates on extensive 'ggplot'-like scatter plots; (ii) you can draw multiple gates; and (iii) you can save your gates and apply the programmatically.

name: r-tidygate
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.0.19" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-tidygate
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/tidygate_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/tidygate/tidygate_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ffed1761003488eca6529a2dabb8b2e4401ae7e57f8db78f68be796c42ec3613

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-magrittr
    - r-plotly
    - r-purrr
    - r-rcolorbrewer
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-shiny
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyr
    - r-viridis
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-magrittr
    - r-plotly
    - r-purrr
    - r-rcolorbrewer
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-shiny
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyr
    - r-viridis

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('tidygate')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('tidygate')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/stemangiola/tidygate
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: It interactively or programmatically label points within custom gates on two dimensions <https://github.com/stemangiola/tidygate>. The information is added to your tibble. It is based on the package 'gatepoints' from Wajid Jawaid (who is also author of this package). The code of 'gatepoints' was nto integrated
    in 'tidygate'. The benefits are (i) in interactive mode you can draw your gates on extensive 'ggplot'-like scatter plots; (ii) you can draw multiple gates; and (iii) you can save your gates and apply the programmatically.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
